intro: Cleidion comptonii, commonly known as the Compton's ceiba, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, buttressed roots and broad, palmate leaves. The tree produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
